name: Harold Holt
what_did:
Harold Holt was Australia’s Prime Minister in the 1960s.
He supported new laws for Aboriginal rights and helped Australia become closer to the United States.
He disappeared while swimming at the beach and was never found.
why_matters:
Holt led Australia through big changes, especially in rights and world relationships.
His sudden disappearance shocked the country.
fun_fact: There’s a swimming pool in Melbourne named after Harold Holt — even though he vanished while swimming!
